Description: Pottery sherd of lid with red slip on outside and added white paint.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Nile silt fabric. Fitton, J.L., Hughes, M. and Quirke, S. (1998), ‘Northerners at Lahun: Neutron Activation Analysis of Minoan and related pottery in the British Museum’, in S. Quirke (ed.) Lahun Studies, p. 126 Has been seen as Minoan inspired, but no longer thought to be the case.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A566)
Kemp & Merrillees 1980 / Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt (Ka.25) (p. 72)
